intro: Gypsophila eriocalyx, commonly known as the baby's breath or silk flower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often used in floral arrangements due to its delicate appearance and long-lasting blooms. Gypsophila eriocalyx is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
